snippet: Heidi Heitkamp, a Democrat running for the Senate, is well liked in this conservative state, making the contest a real fight.
abstract: Heidi Heitkamp, Democratic Senate candidate in North Dakota, has made race against her Republican rival Rep Rick Berg, an unexpectedly tough fight; Senate Republicans assumed state would go red when veteran Democratic Senator Kent Conrad announced his retirement last year, but Heitkamp is making headway through hard work, calibrated attacks and likability, an intangible that goes far in North Dakota; race could help decide control of the Senate.
lead_paragraph: Heidi Heitkamp, a Democrat running for the Senate, is well liked in this conservative state, making the contest a real fight.

headline.seo: Democratic Heidi Heitkamp Is Strong in G.O.P. North Dakota
headline.main: ‘North Dakota Nice’ Plays Well in Senate Race
headline.print_headline: ‘North Dakota Nice’ Plays Well in Senate Race
